column4: How can I debug my preseed/kickstart system, the append paramter is not being used:   append auto preseed/url=http://192.168.1.250/lucid_x86_kickseed.cfg initrd=ubuntu/lucid/amd64/initrd.gz -- quiet
but the PXE client is booting from the correct kernel, and i can cat /proc/cmdline and it shows what is appended to the kernel command, but the installer is still asking me questions....
I am doing a tail -f on my apache log for that server, the installer never tries to download it, any ideas?
use the key combination ctrl+shift+f4
and what do I need to look for?
I don't see any errors, and its not letting me scroll up
yes, it won't let u scroll
what is the problem u r facing for which u would like to debug
but what could I be looking for, I see DEBUG stuff, but no ERROR or ALERT's there
if there r no errors, then ur setup is working fine :)
the whole point of a preseed and using the auto kernel option is that it shouldn't be asking me any questions
ok, so basically ur kickstart file is not getting used or accessed for installation
correct
it's not getting accessed at all, I'm watching all logs that pertain to the webserver hosting it
I can continue the installation, and when installing packages it will obtain them from my webserver, so I know i'm watching the right place
u need to insert a different line, rather than the preseed stuff, just a min, i'll tell u that
in ur text.cfg file append install=url_to_ur_kickstart_file
I'll try that
i'm getting debootstrap error when it tries to install the base component, r u facing anything like that
no, nothing like that, and it still ignores the append options
I got the problem, and I know what it is now
